meanings.definition: A Jewish festival commemorating the exodus of the Israelites from Egypt.
meanings.sent1: During Passover, Jewish families gather to celebrate their ancestors' journey.
meanings.sent2: Passover is an important holiday in the Jewish faith.
meanings.sent3: At the Passover feast, the matzo decided to dance around the table.
meanings.sent4: The spirit of freedom during Passover fills the hearts of those who celebrate.
meanings.sent5: The Passover story teaches valuable lessons about perseverance and faith.

meanings.definition: To move past or go by something.
meanings.sent1: I had to passover the big rock on my way to the river.
meanings.sent2: Cars need to passover other vehicles safely on the road.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to passover the sleeping dog without waking it up.
meanings.sent4: Time will passover all obstacles in its path.
meanings.sent5: The river will passover the fallen tree during heavy rains.

meanings.sent1: Her skills in math passover those of her classmates.
meanings.sent2: The new model will passover the previous one in terms of performance.
meanings.sent3: The cake's sweetness seemed to passover all other desserts at the party.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work will passover any challenges he faces.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset can passover any description in words.
